DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective of this study is to compare the urinary excretion of 14C-labeled risedronate and alendronate over 28 days.
DOC.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics of a Single 14C-labeled Dose of Risedronate or Alendronate Followed by Once-a-week Unlabeled Oral Dose
DOC.criteria: have medical history documentation verifying postmenopausal status of at least 2 years (natural or surgical). If not documented, confirmation will be required using estradiol < 20 pg/mL and follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) > 40 IU/mL; have osteopenia or osteoporosis (< 1.002 g/cm2 Lunar or < 0.882 g/cm2 Hologic) as determined by DXA of the lumbar spine (AP or PA view, L1L4). This corresponds to a Tscore of approximately < 1.5. any clinically significant outofrange laboratory values and vital signs, a clinically significant cardiovascular, hepatic, renal, or parathyroid disease, in the opinion of the Investigator a known hypersensitivity to bisphosphonates
